definition: scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

sentences.english: The amount of power that can be dissipated in a thin target is limited .
sentences.chinese: 薄靶中所可能散逸的功率是有限的。

sentences.english: Last is the exosphere, which is the outermost layer of the atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 最后是散逸层，这是大气的最外层。

sentences.english: It gives way to the whitish stratosphere and then into the mesosphere.
sentences.chinese: 在它之外是发白的平流层，然后是进入散逸层。

sentences.english: Hydrodynamic escape may have stripped Titan of much of its air, too.
sentences.chinese: 流体动力散逸可能也剥夺了土卫六的大部份大气。

sentences.english: Stray mines began to turn up off the Pacific coast, imperilling commercial shipping.
sentences.chinese: 散逸的水雷开始在太平洋海岸出现而危及商船的航行。

sentences.english: I looked into his eyes still clinging onto a life that was quickly departing.
sentences.chinese: 我探入他的眼，看著他紧抓的生命流窜散逸。

sentences.english: Those atoms could simply drift from the planet into space.
sentences.chinese: 这些原子将会散逸进入太空。

definition: to dissipate everywhere (of light, sound, gas etc)
variant of 凝練|凝练[ning2 lian4]
to disperse/to scatter in all directions
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
variant of 彌漫|弥漫[mi2 man4]
to leak out/to release (liquid or gas)
